|məˈti(ə)rēəl| The matter from which a thing is or can be made

“Workshop on open Workflows“ (2014)

2h. workshop jointly taught with Thomas de Graaff at the Department of Spatial Economics, VU University. Amsterdam (Netherlands).

  • Website with link to repository and materials

“Geo-computation in Python” (2013)

4h. workshop taught for the VII Jornadas de SIG libre at SIGTE, Universitat de Girona (Spain). March 6th.

  • Compressed file

“Modeling Spatial Systems: Networks and Spatial Econometrics” (2012)

One day intensive course jointly taught with Dr. Emmanouil Tranos. Department of Spatial Economics, VU University. Amsterdam (Netherlands). December 13th.

  • Introduction to ESDA (slides)
  • Introduction to spatial regression (slides)

“GeoDaSpace: advanced spatial econometrics made easy” (2012)

Talk at the V Spatial Econometrics Seminar in honour of Jean Paelink, Universidade de Coimbra (Portugal). October.

  • Github repository

“An introduction to R” (2012)

2h. workshop co-taught with Nick Malizia for Graduates for Integrative Society and Environment Research (GISER) at Arizona State University in Tempe (AZ). March.

  • Github repository
